title: Englishpod 初级 英文播客 0254

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
My name is Catherine, and today we've got an elementary-level lesson for you all about getting up in the morning.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine，今天我们有一节关于早上起床的初级课程。

segments.en: That's right.
Today we're making breakfast, and well, of course, many people have different things when they're making breakfast.
segments.cn: 今天我们要做早餐，当然，很多人在做早餐时有不同的选择。

segments.en: Some of them are very big, others are small.
segments.cn: 有些很丰盛，有些很简单。

segments.en: But this is what we're going to talk about today, so why don't we listen to the dialogue and see what they're having for breakfast today.
segments.cn: 但这就是我们今天要讨论的内容，所以我们来听听对话，看看他们今天早餐吃什么。

segments.en: Smells good.
What's for breakfast?
Well, since we're getting up so late, I decided to make a big breakfast.
segments.cn: 嗯，既然我们起得这么晚，我决定做一顿丰盛的早餐。

segments.en: Nice brunch.
Kind of.
So I made scrambled and soft-boiled eggs, some French toast, and buttermilk pancakes.
segments.cn: 所以我做了炒蛋和水煮蛋，还有法式吐司和酪乳煎饼。

segments.en: Wow, you really went all out.
Did you make any coffee?
Yeah, just the way you like it.
segments.cn: 是的，正是你喜欢的那种。

segments.en: I also put out some cereal and muesli if you feel like having something more light.
segments.cn: 我还准备了一些麦片和燕麦片，如果你想吃点清淡的。

segments.en: Looks good.
I'll squeeze us some fresh orange juice.
segments.cn: 我来给我们榨些新鲜橙汁。

segments.en: Get the jam and butter while you are in there.
segments.cn: 你在那里的时候拿点果酱和黄油。

segments.en: Oh, and don't forget the syrup.
Alrighty.
Alright, we're back.
So a lot of interesting things.
A huge breakfast.
Way too big for me.
I don't like to eat a big breakfast because I feel like it makes me tired and then I don't have any energy.
segments.cn: 我不喜欢吃丰盛的早餐，因为我觉得这让我感到疲惫，然后没有精力。

segments.en: Especially if you just get up, right?
segments.cn: 尤其是刚起床的时候，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly.
You need to shower and maybe have some fruit and then go to work.
segments.cn: 你需要洗澡，可能吃点水果，然后去工作。

segments.en: But we can talk about that at the end.
segments.cn: 但我们可以在最后讨论这个。

segments.en: There were a lot of interesting words and phrases that we heard that we would benefit from taking a closer look at.
segments.cn: 我们听到很多有趣的单词和短语，值得我们仔细看看。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
Alright, so on Language Takeaway today we're going to take a look at our first word.
segments.cn: 好的，今天的语言收获我们要看第一个单词。

segments.en: And it's an interesting word.
It's kind of a mix of two things.
Brunch.
That's right.
So this word comes from two different words.
segments.cn: 所以这个词来自两个不同的词。

segments.en: Breakfast.
Breakfast and lunch.
That's right.
So brunch.
So if you have brunch, what is exactly?
segments.cn: 那么早午餐到底是什么？

segments.en: Brunch.
Well, there's two ways to look at brunch.
segments.cn: 嗯，有两种看待早午餐的方式。

segments.en: One is the time element.
Usually brunch is later than breakfast.
But maybe a little earlier than lunch.
So 11 o'clock or maybe even noon.
segments.cn: 所以是11点钟或甚至中午。

segments.en: But the other thing is size.
Because you're putting two meals together, usually brunch is very big.
segments.cn: 因为你把两顿饭放在一起，通常早午餐是非常丰盛的。

segments.en: You eat a lot of food.
Okay, so it's a perfect combination of breakfast and lunch.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这是早餐和午餐的完美结合。

segments.en: I'm the type of person that likes having scrambled eggs at noon.
segments.cn: 我是那种喜欢在中午吃炒蛋的人。

segments.en: So this is a perfect solution.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个完美的解决方案。

segments.en: Brunch.
Right, you don't have to only eat eggs at breakfast.
segments.cn: 对，你不必只在早餐吃蛋。

segments.en: You can eat them at lunch as well.
Exactly.
This is actually something we do a lot in America for Mother's Day.
segments.cn: 这实际上是我们在美国母亲节时经常做的事情。

segments.en: So mom wakes up late, we take her to brunch.
segments.cn: 所以妈妈起得晚，我们带她去吃早午餐。

segments.en: It's a very big special meal.
segments.cn: 这是非常丰盛的特别餐。

segments.en: Very good.
And talking about eggs and the types of eggs that we can have.
segments.cn: 说到蛋和我们可以吃的蛋的种类。

segments.en: I mentioned scrambled eggs.
And in the dialogue we also heard soft-boiled eggs.
segments.cn: 在对话中我们还听到了水煮蛋。

segments.en: Okay, these are two very important kinds of eggs.
segments.cn: 好的，这两种蛋非常重要。

segments.en: Usually if you're in a restaurant they will ask you how do you want your eggs cooked or done.
segments.cn: 通常如果你在餐厅，他们会问你想要什么样的蛋。

segments.en: And my answer is always scrambled.
Scrambled.
This means someone mixes the eggs before they are cooked and then when they cook they are hard.
segments.cn: 这意味着有人在煮之前把蛋打散，然后煮的时候变得硬。

segments.en: They're yellow.
Okay.
There's no white.
It's just yellow and it's it's a little hard mixture.
segments.cn: 只有黄色，混合得有点硬。

segments.en: But soft-boiled eggs are very very different.
segments.cn: 但水煮蛋是非常不同的。

segments.en: That's right.
Soft-boiled eggs you actually don't break the egg or open the egg to cook it like in scrambled eggs.
segments.cn: 水煮蛋实际上是你不打破或打开蛋来煮的，就像炒蛋那样。

segments.en: You actually put the entire egg in boiling water.
segments.cn: 你实际上是把整个蛋放入沸水中。

segments.en: I think it's for two minutes and then you take it out and then you open the shell and the eggs are kind of cooked.
segments.cn: 我想是两分钟，然后你把它拿出来，打开蛋壳，蛋就煮好了。

segments.en: It's kind of hard in some parts but it's also kind of liquidy in other parts.
segments.cn: 有些部分是硬的，但其他部分是液态的。

segments.en: That's right.
So the outside the white part is hard but the yellow part the yolk is liquid.
segments.cn: 所以外面的蛋白是硬的，但蛋黄是液态的。

segments.en: It's not hard.
That's right.
And actually if you want the whole egg to be hard you can ask for hard-boiled eggs.
segments.cn: 实际上如果你想要整个蛋都是硬的，你可以要求水煮蛋。

segments.en: That's right.
Those are cooked for much longer.
That's right.
Okay.
So we have scrambled eggs, soft-boiled eggs, we have French toast, and we have buttermilk pancakes.
segments.cn: 所以我们有炒蛋、水煮蛋、法式吐司和酪乳煎饼。

segments.en: Okay.
So you can ask for just pancakes.
But if you want to be specific, you want to give instructions about what kind of pancakes, you can ask for buttermilk pancakes.
segments.cn: 但如果你想具体一点，想说明你要什么样的煎饼，你可以要求酪乳煎饼。

segments.en: And what exactly is buttermilk?
Buttermilk is a very, very creamy eggy milk that's very, very high in fat that makes everything taste better, I think.
segments.cn: 酪乳是一种非常浓稠、非常高脂肪的奶，我认为它能让一切味道更好。

segments.en: This is used a lot in baking, not really in other kinds of foods.
segments.cn: 这在烘焙中使用得很多，而不是其他类型的食物。

segments.en: So you can have buttermilk muffins or buttermilk biscuits, but usually you have buttermilk pancakes.
segments.cn: 所以你可以有酪乳松饼或酪乳饼干，但通常你会有酪乳煎饼。

segments.en: And so these are very rich, very fatty pancakes.
segments.cn: 所以这些是非常丰富、非常油腻的煎饼。

segments.en: Awesome.
Yeah, they taste delicious.
Alright, so now if we want to eat a little bit more healthy, we do have some cereal and some muesli.
segments.cn: 好吧，如果我们想吃得更健康一点，我们有一些谷物和一些麦片。

segments.en: Muesli is a funny word.
It's not a sound we make very often in English.
segments.cn: 这是我们在英语中不常发出的声音。

segments.en: Muesli.
Yeah.
I think it actually comes from German.
segments.cn: 我认为它实际上来自德语。

segments.en: It does look German, because actually the spelling is M-U-E.
segments.cn: 它看起来确实像德语，因为拼写是 M-U-E。

segments.en: So you would kind of want to say muesli, muesli or something.
segments.cn: 所以你可能会想说麦片，麦片之类的。

segments.en: Yeah, no, we say muesli, and it's basically a mixture of granola or different kinds of fiber grains.
segments.cn: 是的，不，我们说麦片，基本上是各种谷物纤维的混合物。

segments.en: Yeah, so just think of having like raisins and maybe some almonds, granola, all mixed up and you have this nice thing that goes well with yogurt, muesli.
segments.cn: 是的，所以想象一下有葡萄干和一些杏仁、格兰诺拉麦片，混合在一起，你就有了这种与酸奶搭配得很好的美味麦片。

segments.en: It's very, very tasty and also very good for you.
segments.cn: 它非常美味，也对你很好。

segments.en: Okay.
And now, well, actually going back to pancakes, no pancake is possible to eat unless you put syrup on it, right?
segments.cn: 现在，实际上回到煎饼，没有煎饼是可以吃的，除非你在上面放糖浆，对吧？

segments.en: Well, some people might disagree.
I know a lot of people who eat pancakes with honey or with butter.
segments.cn: 我知道很多人吃煎饼时用蜂蜜或黄油。

segments.en: True.
But the best, I think, is with syrup.
segments.cn: 但我认为最好的还是糖浆。

segments.en: And syrup is basically liquid sugar.
And you put it on your pancakes to make them sweeter.
segments.cn: 你把它放在煎饼上，让它们更甜。

segments.en: Okay.
Actually, it's the same thing as honey, basically, except that it doesn't come from bees.
segments.cn: 实际上，它和蜂蜜基本上是一样的，只是它不是来自蜜蜂。

segments.en: Right.
So real syrup, we say maple syrup, comes from maple trees and you tap the tree and it comes out.
segments.cn: 所以真正的糖浆，我们说枫糖浆，来自枫树，你在树上打孔，它就流出来。

segments.en: It's very, very, very sweet.
But we also have syrup you can buy at the store, which is man-made.
segments.cn: 但我们也有可以在商店买的糖浆，是人造的。

segments.en: Yeah, it's basically just sugar.
Okay, very good.
So that's what we have with pancakes usually.
segments.cn: 所以这就是我们通常和煎饼一起吃的东西。

segments.en: But why don't we go back, listen to our dialogue again.
segments.cn: 但为什么我们不回去，再听一遍我们的对话呢？

segments.en: Let's review all of these yummy breakfast treats, and we'll come back in a bit with Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 让我们回顾一下这些美味的早餐美食，稍后我们会回来进行流利度训练。

segments.en: Smells good.
What's for breakfast?
Well, since we're getting up so late, I decided to make a big breakfast.
segments.cn: 嗯，既然我们起得这么晚，我决定做一顿丰盛的早餐。

segments.en: Nice brunch.
Kind of.
So I made scrambled and soft-boiled eggs, some French toast, and buttermilk pancakes.
segments.cn: 所以我做了炒蛋和水煮蛋，一些法式吐司，还有酪乳煎饼。

segments.en: Wow, you really went all out.
Did you make any coffee?
Yeah, just the way you like it.
segments.cn: 是的，正是你喜欢的那种。

segments.en: I also put out some cereal and muesli if you feel like having something more light.
segments.cn: 我还准备了一些谷物和麦片，如果你想吃点清淡的。

segments.en: Looks good.
I'll squeeze us some fresh orange juice.
segments.cn: 我来给我们挤一些新鲜的橙汁。

segments.en: Get the jam and butter while you are in there.
segments.cn: 你在那里的时候拿点果酱和黄油。

segments.en: Oh, and don't forget the syrup.
Alrighty.
Alright, so now on Fluency Builder, why don't we take a look at a couple of phrases.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在在流利度训练中，我们来看看几个短语。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
When the guy was kind of surprised, he said, wow, you really went all out.
segments.cn: 当那个人有点惊讶时，他说，哇，你真是全力以赴。

segments.en: Okay, so this comes from the phrase to go all out.
segments.cn: 好的，这来自于短语全力以赴。

segments.en: So he went all out or I'm going to go all out.
segments.cn: 所以他全力以赴，或者我会全力以赴。

segments.en: And this means to give something your best, to do more than is expected.
segments.cn: 这意味着尽力而为，做得比预期的更多。

segments.en: That's right.
So if you go all out when you're making breakfast, it means you just you cooked a lot or really good and you spend a lot of time doing it.
segments.cn: 所以如果你在做早餐时全力以赴，意味着你做了很多或做得很好，并且花了很多时间。

segments.en: Or, for example, if it's someone's birthday and I know it's their birthday, I go all out by buying gifts and a cake and lots of decorations and calling all their friends and having a party.
segments.cn: 或者，例如，如果是某人的生日，我知道是他们的生日，我会全力以赴，买礼物、蛋糕和很多装饰，叫上他们所有的朋友，举办派对。

segments.en: So this is doing everything for them.
segments.cn: 所以这是为他们做一切。

segments.en: That's right.
Okay.
And he was really surprised and he really seemed to enjoy breakfast and he said, looks good.
segments.cn: 他真的很惊讶，他似乎真的很享受早餐，他说，看起来不错。

segments.en: Okay, this is a way to say good job or nicely done.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一种说“做得好”或“干得漂亮”的方式。

segments.en: It's almost a way to say, I'm happy about this.
segments.cn: 这几乎是一种说“我对此很高兴”的方式。

segments.en: Or yeah, and obviously you can also say that the food looks delicious.
segments.cn: 或者是的，显然你也可以说食物看起来很美味。

segments.en: So it looks good.
It looks good.
So it's a way to say, you know, well done, looks good, or in this case, looks very tasty.
segments.cn: 所以这是一种说“干得好，看起来不错”，或者在这种情况下，“看起来非常美味”的方式。

segments.en: That's right.
Okay.
And now this is an interesting part.
segments.cn: 现在这是一个有趣的部分。

segments.en: He says, I'll squeeze us some fresh orange juice.
segments.cn: 他说，我来给我们挤一些新鲜的橙汁。

segments.en: So let's take a look at this verb, squeeze to squeeze.
segments.cn: 所以让我们看看这个动词，挤。

segments.en: This is something you usually do with your hand when you tighten something.
segments.cn: 这通常是用手做的，当你紧握某物时。

segments.en: So for example, your toothpaste.
Yes.
You squeeze your toothpaste.
So the toothpaste will come out.
So in this case, we are squeezing the orange juice to extract the juice.
segments.cn: 所以在这种情况下，我们挤橙汁以提取汁液。

segments.en: That's right.
So you, you hold the orange very tight.
You make the juice come out and then you have fresh squeezed orange juice.
segments.cn: 你让汁液流出来，然后你就有了新鲜挤压的橙汁。

segments.en: And this is different from orange juice you buy in a store.
segments.cn: 这与你在商店买的橙汁不同。

segments.en: Okay.
So you can say I'll squeeze us some fresh orange juice.
segments.cn: 所以你可以说，我来给我们挤一些新鲜的橙汁。

segments.en: That means you're going to make fresh orange juice.
segments.cn: 这意味着你要做新鲜的橙汁。

segments.en: And this fresh orange juice that you make is called fresh squeezed orange juice.
segments.cn: 而你做的这种新鲜橙汁叫做新鲜挤压的橙汁。

segments.en: Fresh squeezed.
You've probably seen this in the store, like some bottles, they say a hundred percent fresh squeezed orange juice or something.
segments.cn: 你可能在商店看到过这种情况，比如一些瓶子上写着百分之百新鲜挤压的橙汁之类的。

segments.en: Yeah, it's good for advertising.
All right.
So very good.
A lot of great interesting phrases there.
Why don't we listen to our dialogue one last time?
segments.cn: 我们再听一遍我们的对话吧。

segments.en: Smells good.
What's for breakfast?
Well, since we're getting up so late, I decided to make a big breakfast.
segments.cn: 嗯，既然我们起得这么晚，我决定做一顿丰盛的早餐。

segments.en: Nice brunch.
Kind of.
So I made scrambled and soft boiled eggs, some French toast and buttermilk pancakes.
segments.cn: 所以我做了炒蛋和水煮蛋，还有法式吐司和酪乳煎饼。

segments.en: Wow.
You really went all out.
Did you make any coffee?
Yeah, just the way you like it.
segments.cn: 是的，正是你喜欢的那种。

segments.en: I also put out some cereal and muesli if you feel like having something more light.
segments.cn: 我还准备了一些麦片和燕麦，如果你想吃点清淡的。

segments.en: Looks good.
I'll squeeze us some fresh orange juice.
segments.cn: 我来给我们榨些新鲜橙汁。

segments.en: Get the jam and butter while you are in there.
segments.cn: 你在那里的时候拿点果酱和黄油。

segments.en: Oh, and don't forget the syrup.
Alrighty.
All right.
So talking about brunch and breakfast, what is your typical or ideal breakfast?
segments.cn: 说到早午餐和早餐，你的典型或理想早餐是什么？

segments.en: Oh, that's a hard question.
Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day, so I could eat breakfast, all kinds of breakfast, anytime.
segments.cn: 早餐是我一天中最喜欢的餐，所以我随时都可以吃各种早餐。

segments.en: But one of my favorite kinds of breakfast is a Greek diner breakfast.
segments.cn: 但我最喜欢的早餐之一是希腊餐厅的早餐。

segments.en: Greek diner.
What does this have?
Okay, well, we have a lot of diners or small restaurants that are very, very cheap and fast in America.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们在美国有很多非常便宜和快速的小餐馆。

segments.en: And this usually involves some scrambled eggs that are made with cheese and toast and potatoes and bacon and sausage and a coffee.
segments.cn: 通常包括一些加了奶酪的炒蛋、吐司、土豆、培根、香肠和咖啡。

segments.en: Wow.
Big breakfast.
Very big.
But delicious.
Nice.
What's your favorite?
Um, I also really, really like breakfast and I actually like having places that you can have 24 hour a day breakfast.
segments.cn: 嗯，我也非常喜欢早餐，实际上我喜欢那些可以全天候提供早餐的地方。

segments.en: All day breakfast, it's called.
So I can have breakfast for dinner.
segments.cn: 所以我可以在晚餐时吃早餐。

segments.en: Right.
That's usually in America, you go to a diner.
Yeah.
Because they have breakfast at four o'clock in the morning or seven o'clock at night.
segments.cn: 因为他们早上四点或晚上七点都有早餐。

segments.en: I'm not really a coffee person.
segments.cn: 我其实不是咖啡爱好者。

segments.en: I actually enjoy either juice, orange juice or hot chocolate.
segments.cn: 我更喜欢果汁，橙汁或热巧克力。

segments.en: I really like hot chocolate.
segments.cn: 我真的很喜欢热巧克力。

segments.en: And definitely pancakes.
Three buttermilk pancakes stacked.
segments.cn: 三个叠在一起的酪乳煎饼。

segments.en: And as you said before, syrup, but I actually also put butter on it.
segments.cn: 正如你之前所说的，糖浆，但我实际上也会放黄油。

segments.en: So gross.
I know a lot of people who do that.
They put butter on first.
Yeah.
And then they pour the syrup.
Yeah, of course.
So it's like complete, very, very fatty and hash browns.
segments.cn: 所以这就很完整，非常油腻，还有土豆饼。

segments.en: I'm definitely a fat enough hash browns.
segments.cn: 我绝对喜欢油腻的土豆饼。

segments.en: Those are potatoes that are chopped very, very finely and you fry them together.
segments.cn: 那些是切得非常细的土豆，然后一起煎。

segments.en: So it almost becomes like a potato pancake.
segments.cn: 所以它几乎变成了土豆煎饼。

segments.en: Yeah, exactly.
So a lot of great stuff.
segments.cn: 所以有很多美味的东西。

segments.en: And obviously, breakfasts around the world are different.
segments.cn: 显然，世界各地的早餐都不同。

segments.en: I know, for example, in some countries, they have the fisherman's breakfast.
segments.cn: 我知道，例如，在一些国家，他们有渔夫的早餐。

segments.en: So in the morning you have black coffee, rice and fish.
segments.cn: 所以早上你会喝黑咖啡，吃米饭和鱼。

segments.en: That's right.
Because you're going to work all day.
So we're really curious about how breakfast is in your country.
segments.cn: 所以我们真的很想知道你们国家的早餐是怎样的。

segments.en: What a typical breakfast is like.
segments.cn: 典型的早餐是什么样的。

segments.en: Yeah.
What are traditional breakfasts and what is your favorite breakfast?
segments.cn: 传统的早餐是什么，您最喜欢的早餐是什么？

segments.cn: 请在我们的网站 EnglishPod.com 上告诉我们。
